summary: Google says it recently fixed an authentication weakness that allowed crooks to circumvent email verification needed to create a Google Workspace account, and leverage that to impersonate a domain holder to third-party services that allow logins through Google's "Sign in with Google" feature
title: Crooks Bypassed Google’s Email Verification to Create Workspace Accounts, Access 3rd-Party Services

summary: The terrible pun in the headline is its own reward (or crime, depending), but I will say that I was moved to look out the office window because I heard an odd noise and couldn’t place what it was.  What it was: The hay baler, wrangling the hay bales into shape.  Ka-thunk, ka-thunk, ka-thunk...
title: Hay Bales Sling, Are You Listening
